question: In context with the Census definition of a “worker” in India, what is the exact meaning of a “Marginal Worker”?
option1: A worker who has not yet attained the age of 16 years
option2: A worker who works as an employee of another worker
option3: A worker who gets employment for less than 6 months
option4: A worker who is in unorganized sector
answer: A worker who gets employment for less than 6 months
explanation: The Census classifies Workers into two groups namely, Main workers and Marginal workers. Main Workers are those workers who had worked for the major part of the reference period i.e. 6 months or more. Marginal Workers are those workers who had not worked for the major part of the reference period i.e. Less than 6 months.
